ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course to any student who seeks to understand not only Durkheim's sociology but also his broad impact on various, seemingly unrelated, branches of the discipline. The course is not an easy one, and requires considerable preparation for each class, but this effort is rewarding.

I would definitely recommend this course to a peer presuming they are interested in Durkheim's work and Durkheim-descended sociological paradigms--the course is rather narrow in its focus, but it delivers what it promises.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: While I am not sure yet about where specifically this course will contribute to my own research, it certainly deepened my understanding of this branch of sociology. I am certain that many of the ideas and articles which have been discussed will be of great help in the future.
I am very glad to have taken the class given that I am interested in a subfield that draws heavily upon Durkheimian sociology.
